DOCNAME: CASE OF CHRISTIAN DEMOCRATIC PEOPLE'S PARTY v. MOLDOVA
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection rejected;Violation of Art. 11;Not necessary to examine under Art. 10;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
JUDGES: Ján Šikuta;Javier Borrego Borrego;Josep Casadevall;Matti Pellonpää;Nicolas Bratza;Rait Maruste;Stanislav Pavlovschi
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant party , ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) , is a parliamentary political party in GPE which was in opposition at the time of the events .
CARDINAL . Towards DATE , the NORP government made public its intention to make the study of the NORP language compulsory in schools for children aged seven and over .
CARDINAL . This initiative prompted vehement criticism from the opposition and generated a heated public debate .

CARDINAL . On DATE the parliamentary group of the ORG informed ORG of its intention to hold a meeting with its supporters on DATE , in FAC , in front of the government buildings . It stated that the meeting would relate to the introduction of the compulsory study of NORP in schools . It relied on LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) which , according to the ORG , did not require members of parliament to obtain prior authorisation for meetings with their supporters .

CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE , ORG classified the gathering to be held on DATE as a “ demonstration ” within the meaning of sections CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and CARDINAL of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) and authorised the parliamentary group of the ORG to hold it in FAC . It did not give any reasons for the change of location .

CARDINAL . Later , on DATE , ORG addressed a letter to ORG , informing it that there was a discrepancy between the provisions of the Status of Members of Parliament Act and those of LAW and that it did not know which to apply . It stated , inter alia , that a number of reputable lawyers supported the idea that the ORG members of parliament had the right to hold meetings with their supporters in ORG without obtaining prior authorisation , in accordance with the provisions of sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Status of Members of Parliament Act . It cited in that respect the opinion of an ombudsman who considered that , since section CARDINAL of the Status of Members of LAW proclaimed the right of MPs to raise demands on the spot for action to remedy a breach of the law , the ORG members of parliament were entitled to raise their demands for the cessation of the alleged breaches concerning the introduction of compulsory NORP lessons in front of the government building , as it also housed ORG . Accordingly , ORG requested ORG to ask ORG for an official interpretation of the legislation in question .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision which stated , inter alia :

“ Having regard to the fact that the provisions of the domestic legislation are contradictory in respect of the demonstrations organised by the ORG and that the opinions of legal experts are contradictory , and bearing in mind the considerable social impact of a possible decision regarding the matter and the consequences it might entail , ORG has formally requested ORG to ask ORG for an official and urgent interpretation of the relevant legislation . ... ORG decision of DATE is hereby suspended until ORG has given its official interpretation . ”

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , the parliamentary group of the ORG held a gathering in FAC , in front of government headquarters . It also held gatherings on CARDINAL , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE . The ORG informed ORG in advance of each gathering ; however , it did not seek authorisation in accordance with LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued an official warning to the ORG in accordance with LAW ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . It stated , inter alia , that the ORG had breached the provisions of LAW by organising demonstrations in FAC on DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE , notwithstanding the authorisation issued by ORG , which only gave permission for a demonstration on DATE in FAC . It called for an immediate halt to the gatherings , which it considered to be illegal and unconstitutional and which it claimed were not meetings with voters within the meaning of the Status of Members of LAW , but demonstrations falling under LAW . It asked the ORG for a written explanation within DATE and warned that , if it failed to comply with the warning , the ORG would impose a temporary ban ( suspendarea activităţii ) on the party 's activities in accordance with LAW ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the President of the ORG wrote a letter to ORG in which he stated that the gatherings had not been organised by the ORG but by members of its parliamentary group , and that it was therefore the members concerned who were liable , and not the party . He also relied on LAW , arguing that it was a very specific LAW , applicable to meetings between members of parliament and voters , while LAW was general in nature . He finally submitted that the threatened ban on the party 's activities would amount to a political measure taken by ORG in order to repress the opposition .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision imposing a DATE ban on the ORG 's activities , in accordance with LAW ORG .
CARDINAL . The measure was imposed on the basis of the organisation by the ORG of unauthorised demonstrations on CARDINAL , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE .

CARDINAL . The Ministry of Justice dismissed the ORG leader 's argument that the party could not be held liable . It stated , inter alia , that the gatherings organised by the ORG on the above dates had in fact been demonstrations and marches and therefore fell within the scope of LAW rather than the Status of Members of LAW as the ORG had claimed .

CARDINAL . According to the decision , the ORG had breached the provisions of sections CARDINAL , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE and CARDINAL of LAW by not obtaining prior authorisation from ORG to stage demonstrations and by blocking the public highway .

CARDINAL . The participation of minors in the ORG demonstrations had been in breach of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) and section CARDINAL(g ) of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . The ORG 's actions also disclosed a violation of sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Parties and other ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) , section CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) of the Status of Members of LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) and LAW ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) . The use of such slogans as “ I 'd rather be dead than a NORP ” ( PERSON decât NORP ) could be interpreted as a call to public violence and an act undermining the legal and constitutional order .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG challenged the decision of ORG arguing , inter alia , that the gatherings had been meetings with voters within the meaning of the Status of Members of Parliament Act , and not assemblies falling within the scope of LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision lifting the temporary ban imposed on the ORG 's activities . It stressed that the ORG had breached all the laws mentioned in the decision of DATE and that the temporary ban had been necessary and justified . However , following an inquiry by the Secretary General of ORG under LAW , and having regard to the forthcoming local elections , the ORG was authorised to resume its activities . The decision of DATE did not , however , set aside the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found in favour of ORG and ruled that the decision of DATE had been lawful . It dismissed the ORG 's argument that the party could not be held liable for the actions of its members , namely its parliamentary group . It found that the gatherings organised by the ORG had in fact been demonstrations , meetings and marches which fell under the provisions of LAW , and not meetings with voters . Even assuming that the gatherings had been intended as meetings with voters , they had gradually taken on the nature of demonstrations and , accordingly , the ORG needed authorisation in order to organise them . It also stated that , as a result of the demonstrations , the public transport company had suffered losses of CARDINAL NORP lei ( MDL ) ( the equivalent of QUANTITY ( ORG ) at the time ) . The participation of minors in the demonstrations had been in breach of LAW , ORG and LAW .
CARDINAL . The ORG lodged an appeal against this decision with ORG , relying , inter alia , on Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Convention .

CARDINAL . On DATE a panel of ORG delivered its judgment , in which it dismissed the appeal lodged by the ORG . It endorsed the arguments of ORG and found , inter alia , that since the demonstrations organised by the ORG had been illegal , the sanction imposed on it had not been disproportionate . It also stated that in any event the decision of ORG had not had any negative effects on the ORG since it had not been enforced , the ORG 's accounts had not been frozen and the party could continue its activities unhindered .

CARDINAL . ORG did not reply to ORG request of DATE for interpretation of the law and did not address any request to ORG . However , on DATE the government lodged an application with ORG asking it , inter alia , to declare the demonstrations organised by the ORG illegal and to order their cessation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ruled in favour of the government and declared the gatherings illegal . It stated , inter alia :

“ Even if one could accept that the ORG had the initial intention of holding meetings with its supporters , those meetings later took on the character of demonstrations , marches , processions and picketing , which fall under the provisions of LAW . In these circumstances , the leaders of the ORG were required to comply with the provisions of LAW ... ”
CARDINAL . The ORG appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the appeal and the judgment of DATE became final .

CARDINAL . In the course of the present proceedings before ORG , the Government submitted a video with images of gatherings held by the ORG deputies on CARDINAL , DATE , DATE and DATE . The gatherings were held in FAC , in a pedestrian area , in front of the government buildings . The participants appeared to number CARDINAL and included people of different ages varying from schoolchildren to pensioners . According to the time displayed on the images , the gatherings commenced at TIME and lasted for TIME . Different personalities made speeches critical of the ruling ORG , the government and its policy . It appears from the video that traffic was not disrupted as a result of the gatherings held on those dates , and no signs of violence can be seen . “ The ORG 's Anthem ” ( PERSON DATE a song that originated in the DATE GPE student demonstrations ) was played frequently . The chorus of the song had the following wording :
“ I 'd rather be a slacker than a traitor ( PERSON haimana , decât trădător )
I 'd rather be a hooligan than a dictator ( PERSON huligan , decât dictator )
I 'd rather be a layabout than an activist ( PERSON , decât activist )
I 'd rather be dead than a NORP ( PERSON , decât NORP ) . ”
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW of GPE reads as follows :

“ CARDINAL . Denial and defamation of the ORG and of the people , incitement to war of aggression , incitement to hatred on ethnic , racial or religious grounds , incitement to discrimination , territorial separatism or public violence , as well as other acts undermining the constitutional order shall be forbidden and shall be punishable under the law . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the Status of Members of Parliament Act of DATE provide :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Members of parliament shall be obliged strictly to observe the LAW , the laws and the rules of morality and ethics .

( CARDINAL ) NORP Members of parliament shall have a duty to be dependable and to contribute by their own example to the consolidation of ORG discipline , the fulfilment of civil obligations , the protection of human rights and the observance of the law .
( CARDINAL ) Alleged breaches of the rules of ethics by members of parliament shall be examined by ORG , Appointments and ORG . ”

“ Local authorities shall provide members of parliament with all necessary assistance for the organisation of their work with voters . They shall place premises at their disposal for meetings with voters . ”
On DATE section CARDINAL ) was amended as follows :

“ Local authorities shall provide members of parliament with the necessary assistance for the organisation of their work with voters . For this purpose , they [ the local authorities ] shall ensure access to buildings or other public places , provide equipment and any necessary information and inform voters in good time about the place and the time of meetings with members of parliament . ”
On DATE a new section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) was introduced :
“ Members of parliament shall have the right to organise demonstrations , meetings , processions and other peaceful gatherings in accordance with LAW . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) Members of parliament , in their capacity as representatives of the supreme legislative power , shall have the right to raise demands on the spot for action to remedy a breach of the law ... ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW of DATE read as follows :
“ Assemblies may be conducted only after the organisers have notified the local council . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) ORG shall be conducted peacefully , without any sort of weapons , and shall ensure the protection of participants and the environment , without impeding the normal use of public highways , road traffic and the operation of economic undertakings and without degenerating into acts of violence capable of endangering the public order and the physical integrity and life of persons or their property . ”
On DATE the following provision was added to the section :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Teachers or other school staff members shall not involve students in unauthorised assemblies . ”
“ Assemblies shall be suspended in the following circumstances :
( a ) denial and defamation of the ORG and of the people ;
( b ) incitement to war of aggression and incitement to hatred on ethnic , racial or religious grounds ;
( c ) incitement to discrimination , territorial separatism or public violence ;
( d ) acts that undermine the constitutional order . ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) ORG may be conducted in squares , streets , parks and other public places in cities , towns and villages , and also in public buildings .
( CARDINAL ) It shall be forbidden to conduct an assembly in the buildings of the public authorities , the local authorities , prosecutors ' offices , the courts or companies with armed security .
( CARDINAL ) It shall be forbidden to conduct assemblies :
( a ) within QUANTITY of the parliament building , the residence of the President of GPE , the seat of the government , ORG and ORG ;

( b ) within QUANTITY of the buildings of the central administrative authority , the local public authorities , courts , prosecutors ' offices , police stations , prisons and social rehabilitation institutions , military installations , railway stations , airports , hospitals , companies which use dangerous equipment and machines , and diplomatic institutions .
( CARDINAL ) PERSON access to the premises of the institutions listed in subsection ( CARDINAL ) shall be guaranteed .
( CARDINAL ) The local public authorities may , if the organisers agree , establish places or buildings for permanent assemblies . ”
“ The date and time of the assembly shall be agreed by the organiser and the local council of the city , town or village . ”
“ ( CARDINAL ) Not DATE prior to the date of the assembly , the organiser shall submit a notification to ORG , a specimen of which is set out in the annex which forms an integral part of this LAW .
( CARDINAL ) The prior notification shall indicate :
( a ) the name of the organiser of the assembly and the aim of the assembly ;
( b ) the date , starting time and finishing time of the assembly ;
( c ) the location of the assembly and the access and return routes ;
( d ) the manner in which the assembly is to take place ;
( e ) the approximate number of participants ;
( f ) the persons who are to ensure and answer for the sound conduct of the assembly ;
( g ) the services the organiser of the assembly asks ORG to provide .
( CARDINAL ) If the situation so requires , ORG may alter certain aspects of the prior notification with the agreement of the organiser of the assembly . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) When the prior notification is considered at an ordinary or extraordinary meeting of ORG , the discussion shall deal with the form , timetable , location and other conditions for the conduct of the assembly and the decision taken shall take account of the specific situation . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of the Parties and other ORG of DATE provide :

“ ... In the event that breaches of the statute or of the law are discovered in the activities of a party or a socio - political organisation , ORG shall warn its leaders in writing , requesting that the breaches be remedied within a fixed time - limit . ”

“ ORG shall impose a temporary ban on the activities of a party or socio - political organisation which breaches the provisions of the LAW or those of the present LAW , or does not comply with a warning . ”
On DATE , this paragraph was amended as follows :
“ ORG shall impose a temporary ban on the activities of a party or socio - political organisation which breaches the provisions of the LAW .
In this case , ORG shall inform the party 's leadership in writing of the breaches of the law which have taken place and will set a time - limit for action to remedy them .
During electoral campaigns the activities of parties and other socio - political organisations may be suspended only by ORG .

During the temporary ban , it shall be forbidden for the party to use the mass media , to disseminate propaganda and publicity , to carry out bank transactions or other operations in respect of its assets and to participate in elections .
Once all the breaches of the law have been remedied , the party shall inform ORG , which shall lift the temporary ban within DATE .
The activities of the party or other socio - political organisation may be suspended for a period DATE . If the breaches of the law are not remedied its activities may be suspended for DATE . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW DATE read as follows :
“ CARDINAL . DATE States Parties recognise the rights of the child to freedom of association and to freedom of peaceful assembly .

CARDINAL . No restrictions may be placed on the exercise of these rights other than those imposed in conformity with the law and which are necessary in a NORP society in the interests of national security or public safety , public order ( ordre public ) , the protection of public health or morals or the protection of the rights and freedoms of others . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant parts of ORG of DATE provide :
“ ( CARDINAL ) Children shall have the right to membership of non - governmental organisations in accordance with the law .
( CARDINAL ) The ORG must provide children 's non - governmental organisations with financial support , place LOC at their disposal and provide them with fiscal incentives .
( CARDINAL ) The involvement of children in politics and their membership of political parties shall be forbidden . ”

( g ) not to involve children in street actions ( meetings , demonstrations , picketing , etc . ) . ”

“ CARDINAL . NORP The organisation and holding of an assembly without prior notification to ORG or without authorisation from the ORG , or in breach of the conditions ( manner , place , time ) concerning the conduct of meetings indicated in the authorisation shall be punishable by a fine to be imposed on the organisers ( leaders ) of the assembly in an amount equal to between CARDINAL and CARDINAL times the minimum DATE wage . ...
CARDINAL . Active participation in an assembly referred to in paragraph CARDINAL of the present Article shall be punishable by a fine in an amount between MDL CARDINAL and MDL CARDINAL . ”
